title: Drawing, "Costume Design for a Boyar", 1921
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on  buff-colored wove paper
markings: Stamps: verso: in black ink, lower right: COLLECTION / OF / SIMON LISSIM; in purple ink, upper left, verso, a Russian-language stamp.
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right: A. Exter
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and red ink, upper left: illegible inscription in Russian and illegible signature, and dated May 31, 1921; on verso in graphite, upper left: No. 94; center: encircled 26.
dimensions:
45.7 x 36.7 cm (18 x 14 7/16 in.) at widest point
Mat:  55.9 x 40.6 cm (22 x 16 in.)
description: Russian Constructivist-style costume design of grey-bearded old man in long blue robe and maroon coat and hat with black (fur?) trim. One up-turned hand is raised across figure's chest.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
